claim: People depicted in a video that circulated in mid-June 2023 were neo-Nazi militia members who were gathering to support former U.S. President Donald Trump.

Video_information.Video_descriptor: The video begins in an indoor setting, possibly a hall or convention center, where a large group of people is seated in organized rows of chairs, many of them wearing vests adorned with a circular logo. A man is seen playing an instrument, engaging the audience as the camera captures the ambiance of the gathering, which is accented by brightly lit surroundings and banners hanging from the ceiling. The scene shifts as the camera pans out, revealing a crowd of individuals standing and facing forward, some with vests featuring designs resembling a face, indicating their participation in a cohesive group or organization. As the camera transitions, it focuses on another man playing the drums, further energizing the atmosphere in front of the crowd. The video continues with another sweeping view of the audience, depicting attendees both seated and standing, evoking a sense of anticipation. The gathering feels ceremonial with the rows of chairs and visible banners, suggesting a structured event. Finally, the video concludes with the crowd applauding, solidifying the sense of communal celebration and engagement, as the excitement culminates in a moment of shared appreciation, encapsulated in the visual narrative portrayed throughout.
